decoworld.gdxmodel.entities

Class MapGraphicsModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.gdxmodel.CachingGraphicsModel
      • decoworld.gdxmodel.entities.MapGraphicsModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphicsModel

    public class MapGraphicsModel
extends CachingGraphicsModel
    Graphics model for rendering a map. This is a caching graphics model that can be added to the delegating graphics model so that it can render a MapEntity.

      • getZ

        public double getZ()
        Retrieve the z-index.
        Returns:
        the z-index.

      • applicable

        public boolean applicable(decoworld.model.world.WorldItem item)
        Checks whether a WorldItem can be rendered with this graphics model.
        Parameters:
        item - the item we wish to render with this graphics model.
        Returns:
        True if item can be rendered (is a MapEntity), otherwise false.

      • onApplicationCreate

        public void onApplicationCreate()
        This function is called when a MapGraphicsModel is created. Here we do tasks that we do not want to repeat each time the map is rendered.

      • create

        public java.util.Collection<Renderable> create(decoworld.model.world.WorldItem item)
        An RMap renderable has not yet been created for the WorldItem we wish to render, so we create one.
        Specified by:
        create in class CachingGraphicsModel
        Parameters:
        item, - the WorldItem we wish to render.
        Returns:
        a collection containing only the RMap we have created.

      • update

        public java.util.Collection<Renderable> update(java.util.Collection<Renderable> renderables,
                                      decoworld.model.world.WorldItem item)
        Update a collection of renderables in response to changes in the world model. Does nothing.
        Specified by:
        update in class CachingGraphicsModel
        Parameters:
        renderables - the renderables we want to update.
        item - a WorldItem.
        Returns:
        the renderables passed in to the method.
